00031 #ifndef _GNU_SOURCE
00032 #define _GNU_SOURCE
00033 #endif
00034 #include <sys/param.h>
00035 #include <sys/socket.h>
00036 #include <sys/poll.h>
00037 #include <netinet/in.h>
00038 
00039 #include <stdio.h>
00040 #include <stdlib.h>
00041 #include <string.h>
00042 #include <memory.h>
00043 #include <errno.h>
00044 #include <fcntl.h>
00045 #include <signal.h>
00046 #include <unistd.h>
00047 /* For time() */
00048 #include <time.h>
00049 /* For waitpid() */
00050 #include <wait.h>
00051 
00052 #include "gssd.h"
00053 #include "err_util.h"
00054 
00055 extern struct pollfd *pollarray;
00056 extern int pollsize;
00057 
00058 #define POLL_MILLISECS  500
00059 
00060 static volatile int dir_changed = 1;
00061 
00062 static void dir_notify_handler(int sig, siginfo_t *si, void *data)
00063 {
00064         dir_changed = 1;
00065 }
00066 
00067 static void
00068 scan_poll_results(int ret)
00069 {
00070         int                     i;
00071         struct clnt_info        *clp;
00072 
00073         for (clp = clnt_list.tqh_first; clp != NULL; clp = clp->list.tqe_next)
00074         {
00075                 i = clp->krb5_poll_index;
00076                 if (i >= 0 && pollarray[i].revents) {
00077                         if (pollarray[i].revents & POLLHUP)
00078                                 dir_changed = 1;
00079                         if (pollarray[i].revents & POLLIN)
00080                                 handle_krb5_upcall(clp);
00081                         pollarray[clp->krb5_poll_index].revents = 0;
00082                         ret--;
00083                         if (!ret)
00084                                 break;
00085                 }
00086                 i = clp->spkm3_poll_index;
00087                 if (i >= 0 && pollarray[i].revents) {
00088                         if (pollarray[i].revents & POLLHUP)
00089                                 dir_changed = 1;
00090                         if (pollarray[i].revents & POLLIN)
00091                                 handle_spkm3_upcall(clp);
00092                         pollarray[clp->spkm3_poll_index].revents = 0;
00093                         ret--;
00094                         if (!ret)
00095                                 break;
00096                 }
00097         }
00098 };
00099 
00100 void
00101 lgssd_run()
00102 {
00103         int                     ret;
00104         struct sigaction        dn_act;
00105         int                     fd;
00106         time_t                  child_check = 0;
00107         pid_t                   child_pid;
00108 
00109         /* Taken from linux/Documentation/dnotify.txt: */
00110         dn_act.sa_sigaction = dir_notify_handler;
00111         sigemptyset(&dn_act.sa_mask);
00112         dn_act.sa_flags = SA_SIGINFO;
00113         sigaction(DNOTIFY_SIGNAL, &dn_act, NULL);
00114 
00115         if ((fd = open(pipefs_dir, O_RDONLY)) == -1) {
00116                 printerr(0, "ERROR: failed to open %s: %s\n",
00117                          pipefs_dir, strerror(errno));
00118                 return;
00119         }
00120         fcntl(fd, F_SETSIG, DNOTIFY_SIGNAL);
00121         fcntl(fd, F_NOTIFY, DN_CREATE|DN_DELETE|DN_MODIFY|DN_MULTISHOT);
00122 
00123         init_client_list();
00124 
00125         while (1) {
00126                 while (dir_changed) {
00127                         dir_changed = 0;
00128                         printerr(2, "pipefs root dir changed\n");
00129                         if (update_client_list()) {
00130                                 printerr(0, "ERROR: couldn't update "
00131                                          "client list\n");
00132                                 goto out;
00133                         }
00134                 }
00135 
00136                 /* every 5s cleanup possible zombies of child processes */
00137                 if (time(NULL) - child_check >= 5) {
00138                         printerr(3, "check zombie children...\n");
00139 
00140                         while (1) {
00141                                 child_pid = waitpid(-1, NULL, WNOHANG);
00142                                 if (child_pid <= 0)
00143                                         break;
00144 
00145                                 printerr(2, "terminate zombie child: %d\n",
00146                                          child_pid);
00147                         }
00148 
00149                         child_check = time(NULL);
00150                 }
00151 
00152                 /* race condition here: dir_changed could be set before we
00153                  * enter the poll, and we'd never notice if it weren't for the
00154                  * timeout. */
00155                 ret = poll(pollarray, pollsize, POLL_MILLISECS);
00156                 if (ret < 0) {
00157                         if (errno != EINTR)
00158                                 printerr(0,
00159                                          "WARNING: error return from poll\n");
00160                 } else if (ret == 0) {
00161                         /* timeout */
00162                 } else { /* ret > 0 */
00163                         scan_poll_results(ret);
00164                 }
00165         }
00166 out:
00167         close(fd);
00168         return;
00169 }
